Key Match Events: Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra hit centuries in Black Caps’ victory
New Zealand won by nine wickets with 82 balls to spare
Conway reached 150 off 121 balls, Ravindra off 96 balls
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand’s newbies took control with Conway and Ravindra hunting down the target of 283
New Zealand had no choice but to explore all available bowling options due to injuries to Lockie Ferguson and Tim Southee
Post-Match Reflections: England’s batters struggled to settle throughout the innings
Harry Brook managed to maintain fluency for only three balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jonny Bairstow hit a six in the opening over
Glenn Phillips took two wickets in three overs including Joe Root
